results.title: Cornflakes for tea
results.creator_credit: John Colquhoun, Tom Broadbridge and Andromeda Productions
results.brief_description: Dramatization of how a family living in high-rise inner city flats manage to cope with caring for each other when first their mother and then their father abandon them. Provides many points which could act as stimulus for discussion including perspectives on family relationships, contrasts on single parent and conventional nuclear families, welfare workers and their role, supportive community members, and the warm relationship of the central characters.

results.title: Rainy season
results.brief_description: In this video diary style film, Kuchar lets go of his usual comic persona to explore “the depression inherent to festive occasions.” From Thanksgiving dinner with friends, to a student film night disrupted by a riot, to a solemn conversation with a lover. Kuchar demonstrates the melancholy that accompanies his day-to-day routine in the rainy California holiday season.

results.title: Weather diary #5
results.brief_description: The latest ‘chapter’ of the remarkable Weather Diary series finds Kuchar observing his personal, social and natural environment with wry humor and introspection. Writes Kuchar: ‘Set in central Oklahoma during May, I spend 3 weeks in a motel and get talked at by a small weather-radio that seems to rule my life. I, myself, get to talk at the lady who runs the motel and who runs a cosmetic empire downtown. The viewer gets to see her equipment and her corner of the world as storms lurk somewhere off-camera, waiting to enter stage left and bring down the house. This is one of the more social installments of the weather diary series’.

results.title: Remembering Janefield ...
results.creator_credit: Eastern Energy and Land Use Team, State of Victoria, Department of Human Services and Tribal Communications
results.brief_description: Provides a brief history of the Janefield Training Centre, Bundoora with both ex-residents and ex-staff members sharing anecdotes and moving reflections on their experiences and years at the institution.

results.title: One of the family
results.creator_credit: Bernice Rubens, Derrick Knight and Derrick Knight and Partners
results.brief_description: An assessment of handicapped children which concludes that the frustration of the child is usually less than that of the parents; but with understanding, both parents and children alike can come to terms with their problems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bernice Rubens, Derrick Knight and Derrick Knight and Partners

results.title: Would You Like to Fly?
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Department of the Interior and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description:
This film was produced by John Kingsford-Smith, nephew of the renowned aviator Charles Kingsford-Smith. John Kingsford-Smith became a successful and prolific producer of documentaries from 1948 to the 1980s. During this time he produced 327 sponsored films and commercials and played a key creative role in all of them (as writer, director, cinematographer or editor).

This film is a combination of his two passions, aviation and filmmaking; one may wonder how many people were spurred on to learn how to fly after watching this film!
